Package application

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • application.Main

  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    Main Class extending Application in JavaFX Library. This class is responsible for the GUI and setting the 'bounds' of the grid.
    Author:
    Neel Drain

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)

      • initActiveState

        public void initActiveState​(int Bounds)
        The method to setup the attributes of the primayStage UI for CritterWorld 1. Initializes grid with the bounds passed, and the canvas size of screen.getHeight()-150
        2.Sets an HBox for the top of root and gives it a:
        TextField to set the increment amount,
        Button when pressed increments the world,
        Button when pressed resets the world to another random population
        ComboBox to select a Critter type to be spawned
        Button when pressed spawns the Critter given by the adjacent ComboBox
        3. Creates a color key for the Critter UI representations using a TextFlow and multiple Text objects
        4. Calls initUI(critters.ui.GridPoint[][])
        Parameters:
        Bounds - The int given by the Start method's bStage's button press

      • convertToUI

        public double convertToUI​(int value)

      • copyGrid

        private void copyGrid​()
        Copies gridPoints to prevGridPoints via System.arraycopy

      • resetUI

        public void resetUI​()
        Clears the GraphicsContext gc using GrpahicsContext.clearRect and calls drawGrid(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext)

      • initUI

        public void initUI​(critters.ui.GridPoint[][] gp)
        Creates the initial UI by: 1. Calling drawGrid(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext)
        2. Adding the critters to the UI grid via addCritters(javafx.scene.paint.Color,double,double)
        Parameters:
        gp - The 2D array of GridPoints to be used to draw the intial UI

      • initUI

        public void initUI​()
        1. Calling drawGrid(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext)
        2. Adding the critters to the UI grid via addCritters(javafx.scene.paint.Color,double,double)

      • updatePopulation

        public void updatePopulation​()

      • increment

        public void increment​()
        Clears the GraphicsContext gc, calls drawGrid(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext), and initUI(critters.ui.GridPoint[][])

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid​(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Draws the UI grid in the given GraphicsContext
        Parameters:
        gc - The GraphicsContext to be used to draw with

      • addCritters

        public void addCritters​(javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
                        double x,
                        double y)
        Adds a GraphicsContext.fillRect to the UI grid, representing a critter
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the critter rect
        x - The x position of the top left corner of the critter rect
        y - The y position of the top left corner of the critter rect
